intro: Sterigma acanthocarpum, commonly known as the spiny acanthocarp, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive spiny pods that contain compressed seeds. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are trifoliate, with small, oval-shaped leaflets. The flowers are usually small and clustered, contributing to its ornamental value in certain regions.
